text: Claudius Aelianus (, modern Greek transliteration Klávdios Elianós;Η φυσιογνωμία ενός λαού θεμελιών. Μύθοι για την Ελιά. Retrieved June 5, 2011, from http://www.etwinning.gr/projects/elia/muthoi.htm c. 175c. 235 AD), commonly Aelian () was a teacher from Latium. He was born around the year 170. He died after 220. Even though he was from Rome, he wrote in Greek. In English, he is often referred to as Aelian. == References == Category:175 births Category:235 deaths Category:Ancient Greek writers
title: Claudius Aelianus
